One thousand shall flee at the rebuke of one. The Jerusalem Bible reads, "A thousand will flee at the threat of one." The Lord had earlier promised Israel that five of them would chase one hundred enemies and that one hundred of them would put ten thousand to flight (Lev. 26:8) because the Lord would be with them. But that promise was no longer in effect, and now Judah would be put to flight because she abandoned God.

till ye be left as a beacon…and as an ensign. Where there had once been a multitude living in a city, only a small remnant would be left. Although only a few of Judah's population would remain, they will still act as an ensign and beacon, or light to the world.
